lexUnit.name: sore.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a raw or painful place on the body.

sentence.text: They can also develop pressure sores on the elbows and other joints .
He was suffering from frequent migraine attacks and had persistent desert sores which refused to heal .
While Paddy Mayne and his men were busily raiding , Stirling had finally succumbed to his desert sores and had been hospitalized in Cairo .
Herpes simplex , the virus responsible for cold sores on the lips and face , is also involved in genital infection .
In these cases the infection has been contracted during passage through the birth canal from sores on the mother 's genitalia .
The primary sore may still be present in about one third of cases of secondary syphilis .
The sores are usually relatively painless , and this procedure , like the urethral investigation , need give no cause for alarm .
The patient should be nursed in a comfortable position which should be changed frequently to avoid pressure sores .
An old person who is bedbound may get pressure sores or ulcers in a very short time and these can take a long time to heal ( see page 78 ) .
There are a few people who develop sores or cracked skin at the corner of the mouth and suffer from riboflavin or vitamin B2 deficiency .
Wherever we walked people asked us to treat inflamed eyes , limbs swollen by filariasis , and all manner of festering sores .
There were sores of malnourishment at the edge of his mouth , and his skin was crossed with premature folds and lines , like a map of the face of his father .
Look out for smell of solvent on breath , nose-bleeds , sores around nose and mouth , weight loss .
For a long time her hands , especially the tips of her fingers , had been covered in dreadful wart-like sores .
His wife must not only train up her children and maids in fear of God but attend to the wounds and sores of parishioners with her own hands .
Going down on your partner is safe as long as you do not have bad cuts or sores in the mouth , or bleeding gums .
Boils and sores burst out over his flesh , his body becomes hunched and arthritic , his skin aged and withered .
His description of the bed sores , gangrene , and so on , is unsuitable for these pages , but not his conclusion .
Festering open sores marred his face and abdomen .
All of us had sores and infections on our hands and arms from the cold and the dirt .
His lower jaw , lips and nose had been infested with open sores and scabs , much of the flesh eaten away .
The Robemaker 's skin was covered with suppurating sores , great festering , oozing ulcers , leprous growths , cancerous chancres .
Hayley Burton was thin and very pale , with small sores around her mouth and nose , greasy fair hair that had n't been washed in weeks , and dark-shadowed pale blue eyes .
He walked with a limp , and had you not known better you could have mistaken the sores and scabs on his face for the kind of wounds worn by down-and-outs in Cardboard City .
